--- title: Optional Configuration hiddenFromSearch: true --- #### SSH Key Authentication 1. Open the Client GUI and select `Tools` and then `Manage Keys...` 1. Select `+` to open the form for creating a new key. ![New SSH Key +](./images/createSSHKey.png) 1. Complete the form and select `OK`: - **Identity**: The name of the new Key. - **Passphrase**: Optional password to protect the key. Note: If you configure a password each time the client makes a connection to the server you will be asked to re-enter this password. - **Type**: Leave as RSA Access: Select if you would like all users of the Client machine to be able to use this key to authenticate with the Server. 1. Copy the `Public Key` displayed in the lower pane of the SSH Keys window. 1. Login to the Server 1. Prepare the `asp1` user for key based authentication. ```bash mkdir /home/asp1/.ssh touch /home/asp1/.ssh/authorized_keys chown -R asp1:asp1 ~/.ssh chmod 700 ~/.ssh chmod 600 ~/.ssh/authorized_keys ``` 1. Paste the `Public Key` copied from the Client into the `/home/asp1/.ssh/authorized_keys` file export default ({children}) =>
{children}
